Title: Xdg-Utils: Arbitrary command execution
Synopsis:
A vulnerability has been discovered in Xdg-Utils, allowing for the remote
    execution of arbitrary commands.

Background.Text: Xdg-Utils is a set of tools allowing all applications to easily integrate with the Free Desktop configuration.

Description.Text: Miroslav Lichvar discovered that the "xdg-open" and "xdg-email" shell scripts do not properly sanitize their input before processing it.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted link with a vulnerable application using Xdg-Utils (e.g. an email client), resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Xdg-Utils users should upgrade to the latest version:
